channel.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
channel.description:
It seems that a lot of websites (both large and small) are following in reddits footsteps and blacking out on January 18th in protest of the SOPA and PIPA bills. Is there any possibility that this site could do the same?
Read this article for more info: [url]https://hotair.com/archives/2012/01/14/reddit-plans-blackout-to-protest-sopa-other-websites-may-follow/[/url]

item.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
item.dc:creator: Speed
item.description:
Lolz at replys to my post, but anyway, its kinda exaggerated, but its basicly saying, future with SOPA, boring as a rock,
but without SOPA, maybe we can actully look foward to something, and this is all of course assuming the world dosent end in December. :tired:

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
item.dc:creator: NerdRage
item.description:
Government is trying to control us!
The “National Defense Authorization Act” was passed on New Years Eve

Here’s an article on it: https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2012/01/02/president-obama-signed-the-national-defense-authorization-act-now-what/

To summarize… “Under the new law the US military has the power to carry out domestic anti-terrorism operations on US soil… Worse, the NDAA authorizes the military to detain even US citizens under the broad new anti-terrorism provisions provided in the bill, once again without trial.”

Maybe the world is going to end this year o.O (I’m kidding I don’t believe in that lol)

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
item.dc:creator: karnaoubas
item.description:
Ok, so I am in Greece, Black Mesa Logo is blacked out only at the forum pages, home screen logo seems fine, but parts of the structure, like Twitter or random words are blacked out. It would be better I think if that censored sticker at the upper right corner is bigger so that people may actually see it (I saw it on the second pass), click it and get informed. This would also minimize the “danger” of people thinking that the mod has died or whatever.

Apparently, I am not a citizen of the US, but if this law passes it would affect the whole world, not only because most big sites have US origins but also due to the impact that such a legislation would have globally. In other words, other governments could say, “if the US pulled that off, why can’t we?”. It’s sad to be censored, believe me (or my parents generation which lived 7 years under dicatorship back at the sixties). Our lives won’t get destroyed instantly, but that’s how submission works. Gradually. Make your stand, PEACEFULLY.

PS: Don’t accept the law even if it suffers “dramatic changes” in its text. It’s foul.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
item.dc:creator: MysticJ
item.description:
I’m actually a little sad the bill won’t pass.

What? You fuckin crazy?

No, really! Because the bill states that any 3rd party which makes available, encourages or shows how to pirate is liable for the damages caused, even if that party didn’t themselves pirate. And since sites strongly supported by Warner, Microsoft etc. are the #1 download sites for torrenting software and even show how to pirate using hot stuff like “Beatles” or “Beyonce”, they would be the first to sue for billions of dollars of damages.

Wish I were the fly on the wall

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
item.dc:creator: Guzzi
item.description:
PandaMassacre:

This bill should be taken a little more seriously, it essentially infringes upon our constitution and takes away freedoms that we as Americans are entitled to.

      If we don't stand for our rights that we are entitled to, then we are not entitled to those rights. 

      Everyone must stand against the bill for it not to pass. We as the people have a job too, and that is to scrutinize our government when they have taken interest in a goal not directed towards the constitution. 

      Sadly though, there are allot of people otherwise preoccupied with the distractions that pull us away from our motivation to fight for our freedom. 

     This is my own bleak perception of the world that motivates me to spread the word.

     Please help me spread that word as I am helping spread the word with the world.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Blackout?
item.dc:creator: lunertexcosmo
item.description:
Khaos124:

I agree with dragon, its not necessary, but it would really give a positive image for the dev team, and maybe even a sign to some that the mod is alive, in an ironic kind of way.

Sounds like that actually might work. But as the other person said, we may have people speculate the mod may come out soon. One of the devs said that any little action on the site almost instantly gets people thinking that the mod will be out the next day. Especially since a major update to the site, wiki, and forums are planned as well. BUT, Black Mesa is still a widely known thing on the internet so many would take it seriously. As well as let people know that the mod is indeed alive.

And I know this is off subject, but who’s that dude in your sig? And where’d you get the GIF?

Read full topic
